gov.usgs.anss.util

Class FUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.usgs.anss.util.FUtil

  • public final class FUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    All methods in this class are static so no instances of FUtil are allowed This is a helper class for fields represented as "JTextFields" that need to represent numbers, dates, and other "verifiable" things. The textfield color will be changed to "UC.red" if it does no parse or is out of range. Error information is kept in the "ErrorTrack" class object and allow us to track the number of errors found and pass error messages for display on the form. Other helpers include the searchJComboBox() for aiding user typing in partial names to find

      • chkTime

        public static java.sql.Time chkTime(javax.swing.JTextField t,
                                    ErrorTrack err)
        chkTime validate are user entered logfile in a JTextField via the "ErrorTrack" system. If the text is empty the earliest possible time is returned. User needs to enter time without directory paths (no '/' allowed.
        Parameters:
        t - A JTextField containing the date
        err - The ErrorTrack field
        Returns:
        The value of logfile decoded from the text

      • chkLogfile

                                          ErrorTrack err)
        chkTime validate are user entered time in a JTextField via the "ErrorTrack" system. If the text is empty the earliest possible time is returned. User needs to enter time in 00:00:00 format.
        Parameters:
        t - A JTextField containing the date
        err - The ErrorTrack field
        Returns:
        The time decoded from the text

      • chkDate

        public static java.sql.Date chkDate(javax.swing.JTextField t,
                                    ErrorTrack err)
        Check the JTextField for a properly formatted date. If blank the date is returned as a very early SQL date. Will handle dates in mm/dd/yy or mm/dd/yyyy or yyyy/mm/dd form. Slashes can be dashes as well. Two digit years are resolved by the "rule of 50" - 50> add 1900 <50 add 2000.
        Parameters:
        t - The textfield
        err - the ErrorTrack
        Returns:
        a formated SQL date

      • chkDatetime2

        public static java.sql.Date chkDatetime2(javax.swing.JTextField t,
                                         ErrorTrack err)
        Check the JTextField for a properly formatted date with MySQL datetime type ranges. If blank the date is returned as a very early SQL date. Will handle dates in mm/dd/yy or mm/dd/yyyy or yyyy/mm/dd form. Slashes can be dashes as well. Two digit years are resolved by the "rule of 50" - 5 > add 1900 < 50 add 2000.
        Parameters:
        t - The textfield
        err - the ErrorTrack
        Returns:
        a formatted SQL date

      • chkTimestamp

        public static java.sql.Timestamp chkTimestamp(javax.swing.JTextField t,
                                              ErrorTrack err)
        Verify a timestamp from the JTextField. If "now" set current time/date. If blank, return a very early timestamp. The general form is yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss Though the date can be any form acceptable to chkDate() and check time. This routine uses the space to split the fields.
        Parameters:
        t - The textfield with a date/time
        err - the Errortrack variable
        Returns:
        a valid timestamp possibly a very early one.

      • chkDatetime

        public static java.sql.Timestamp chkDatetime(javax.swing.JTextField t,
                                             ErrorTrack err)
        Verify a timestamp which follows Datetime MySQL format. This allows a much bigger range of data values (9999-12-31) from the JTextField. If "now" set current time/date. If blank, return a very early timestamp (near 1970). The general form is yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss Though the date can be any form acceptable to chkDatetime2() and check time. This routine uses the space to split the fields.
        Parameters:
        t - The textfield with a date/time
        err - the Errortrack variable
        Returns:
        a valid timestamp possibly a very early one.

      • chkTimestampTimeOnly

        public static java.sql.Timestamp chkTimestampTimeOnly(javax.swing.JTextField t,
                                                      ErrorTrack err)
        Verify a timestamp from the JTextField. If "now" set current time/date. If blank, return a very early timestamp. The general form is yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss Though the date can be any form acceptable to chkDate() and check time. This routine uses the space to split the fields.
        Parameters:
        t - The textfield with a date/time
        err - the Errortrack variable
        Returns:
        a valid timestamp possibly a very early one.

      • stringToTimestamp

        public static java.sql.Timestamp stringToTimestamp(java.lang.String s)
        Convert a string to a Timestamp. If the time is not present, assume 00:00
        Parameters:
        s - The string to attempt to convert
        Returns:
        The corresponding time stamp or the times stamp for 0

      • chkIP

        public static java.lang.String chkIP(javax.swing.JTextField t,
                                     ErrorTrack err)
        Validate an IP address in dotted number form nnn.nnn.nnn.nnn. This will insure there are 4 bytes in the address and that the digits are all numbers. between the dots the numbers can be one, two or three digits long.
        Parameters:
        t - The textfield with a supposed IP adr
        err - errorTrack variable
        Returns:
        String with the reformated to nnn.nnn.nnn.nnn form

      • chkIP

        public static java.lang.String chkIP(javax.swing.JTextField t,
                                     ErrorTrack err,
                                     boolean nullOK)
        validate an IP address in dotted number form nnn.nnn.nnn.nnn. This will insure there are 4 bytes in the address and that the digits are all numbers. between the dots the numbers can be one, two or three digits long.
        Parameters:
        t - The textfield with a supposed IP adr
        err - errorTrack variable
        nullOK - If true and empty field is O.K and returns an empty string
        Returns:
        String with the reformated to nnn.nnn.nnn.nnn form

      • chkDouble

        public static double chkDouble(javax.swing.JTextField t,
                               ErrorTrack err)
        validate a string field contains a valid double. Report error via ErrorTrack.
        Parameters:
        t - The text
        err - The ErrorTrack
        Returns:
        0 if Double.parseDouble() fails, or field is blank, otherwise the conversion of the text.

        Parameters:
        t - The text
        err - The ErrorTrack
        lower - a double with the lower of acceptable range
        upper - a double with the upper of acceptable range
        Returns:
        0 if Double.parseDouble() fails, or field is blank, otherwise the conversion of the text.

                               ErrorTrack err,

                               double upper,
                               boolean blankOK)
        validate a string field contains a valid double with upper and lower limits inclusive. Report error via ErrorTrack.
        Parameters:
        t - The text
        err - The ErrorTrack
        lower - a double with the lower of acceptable range
        upper - a double with the upper of acceptable range
        blankOK - If true, an empty field is o.k. and returns zero
        Returns:
        0 if Double.parseDouble() fails, or field is blank, otherwise the conversion of the text.

      • chkInt

        public static int chkInt(javax.swing.JTextField t,
                         ErrorTrack err)
        validate that the textfield contains a valid integer. Report via ErrorTrack. Blank field is treated as an error (see other form to allow blank).
        Parameters:
        t - The textfield
        err - The ErrorTrack
        Returns:
        The conversion if no error is returned

      • chkInt

        public static int chkInt(javax.swing.JTextField t,
                         ErrorTrack err,
                         boolean blankOK)
        validate that the textfield contains a valid integer. Report via ErrorTrack. BlankOK allows control of whether a blank field is acceptable.
        Parameters:
        t - The textfield
        err - The ErrorTrack
        blankOK - If true, a blank text returns 0. else its an error
        Returns:
        The conversion if no error is returned

      • searchJComboBox

        public static int searchJComboBox(javax.swing.JComboBox b,
                                  boolean allowNew)
        If a combobox does not have a unique selection, To use this make the JcomboBox "editable" and call this first thing in the action handler. If the user types in something, it attempts to find a unique match in the list. If allowNew is true, the box remains grey and -1 is returned. If allowNew is false, the box turns yellow.
        Parameters:
        b - The jcombobox to search in
        allowNew - Boolean indicating weather a new one is allowed
        Returns:
        The index of the selected item in JComboBox. If <0, No item is selected. This can happen if multiple matches are found or if no match is found

      • searchJComboBox

        public static int searchJComboBox(javax.swing.JComboBox b)
        If a combobox does not have a unique selection, To use this make the JcomboBox "editable" and call this first thing in the action handler. If the user types in something, it attempts to find a unique match in the list. If its not found, the JComboBox is turned RED indicating no select made. If more than one item is found, it is also an error
        Parameters:
        b - The jcombobox to search in
        Returns:
        The index of the selected item in JComboBox. If =-1 No item is matched-> new item If < -1, the minus the number of matches found.

      • searchJComboBoxBeginMatch

        public static int searchJComboBoxBeginMatch(javax.swing.JComboBox b,
                                            boolean allowNew)
        If a combobox does not have a unique selection (must be at beginning, To use this make the JcomboBox "editable" and call this first thing in the action handler. If the user types in something, it attempts to find a unique match in the list. If allowNew is true, the box remains grey and -1 is returned. If allowNew is false, the box turns yellow.
        Parameters:
        b - The jcombobox to search in
        allowNew - Boolean indicating weather a new one is allowed
        Returns:
        The index of the selected item in JComboBox. If <0, No item is selected. This can happen if multiple matches are found or if no match is found

      • searchJComboBoxBeginMatch

        public static int searchJComboBoxBeginMatch(javax.swing.JComboBox b)
        If a combobox does not have a unique selection, To use this make the JcomboBox "editable" and call this first thing in the action handler. If the user types in something, it attempts to find a unique match in the list (beginning of string only). If its not found, the JComboBox is turned RED indicating no select made. If more than one item is found, it is also an error
        Parameters:
        b - The jcombobox to search in
        Returns:
        The index of the selected item in JComboBox. If =-1 No item is matched-> new item If < -1, the minus the number of matches found.

      • searchJComboBox

        public static int searchJComboBox(javax.swing.JComboBox b,
                                  java.lang.String match)
        If a combobox does not have a unique selection, To use this make the JcomboBox "editable" and call this first thing in the action handler. If the user types in something, it attempts to find a unique match in the list. If its not found, the JComboBox is turned RED indicating no select made. If more than one item is found, it is also an error
        Parameters:
        b - The jcombobox to search in
        match - The string to match
        Returns:
        The index of the selected item in JComboBox. If =-1 No item is matched-> new item If < -1, the minus the number of matches found.

      • chkJComboBox

                                java.lang.String field,
                                ErrorTrack err)
        Check that something is selected in a JComboBox. Report errors via error track.
        Parameters:
        b - The JComboBox
        field - Text to put append to ErrorTrack if nothing selected "No "+field+" selected!"
        err - The ErrorTrack

      • getJComboBoxStringToInt

        public static int getJComboBoxStringToInt(javax.swing.JComboBox b,
                                          java.lang.String val)
        Given a JComboBox and a Value which represent the toString() of the items in the JComboBox, return the index to the JComboBox matching the string. This does not change the selection of the JComboBox, its just a lookup.
        Parameters:
        b - The JComboBox
        val - The string value to match again's entries in the box
        Returns:
        the index in JComboBox for the match, -1 if no match

        public static javax.swing.JComboBox getEnumJComboBox(java.sql.Connection C,
                                                     java.lang.String table,
                                                     java.lang.String field)
        Creates a JComboBox with the values of a MySQL enum field.
        Parameters:
        C - a connection to MySQL
        table - The table name in MySQL
        field - The field in the table
        Returns:
        A new JComboBox with the ENUM Strings in database enum order

                                       java.sql.Connection C,
                                       java.lang.String table,
                                       java.lang.String field)
        Update the given JComboBox to reflect the enum. The JCombox is cleared and rebuilt from MySQl
        Parameters:
        b - The JComboBox to reform
        C - a connection to MySQL
        table - The table name in MySQL
        field - The field in the table

      • enumStringToInt

        public static int enumStringToInt(java.util.ArrayList a,
                                  java.lang.String val)
        Given an ArrayList representing an EnumString, search for the given value and return the index in the ArrayList containing a match. Return 0 if match not found. Remember enums alway have zero as a "invalid" value since MySQL starts enums at 1
        Parameters:
        a - The array list to look in.
        val - The value to look for
        Returns:
        The index of the ArrayList which matches. Note; zero is always "invalid" because enums in MySQL start with one.

      • getEnum

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getEnum(java.sql.Connection C,
                                                            java.lang.String table,
                                                            java.lang.String field)
        Get the values of an Enum as an ArrayList. ArrayList[0] is always "invalid" because MySQL does Enum starting at one.
        Parameters:
        C - a connection to MySQL
        table - The table name in MySQL
        field - The field in the table
        Returns:
        The ArrayList with the enum values in it.

      • getFileList

        public static java.util.ArrayList getFileList(java.sql.Connection C,
                                              java.lang.String table,
                                              java.lang.String field)
        Make a ArrayList of a single field from a MySQL table. The index to the array list is the MySQL ID for the row containing the String in the ArrayList.
        Parameters:
        C - a connection to MySQL
        table - The table name in MySQL
        field - The field in the table
        Returns:
        The index to the array list is the MySQL ID for the row containing the String in the ArrayList from the field

      • encodePassword

        public static java.lang.String encodePassword(java.lang.String in)
        Give a string use MySQL to encode it to a password
        Parameters:
        in - The clear text with the password
        Returns:
        The MySQL encoding of this password

      • isTrue

        public static int isTrue(java.lang.String s)
        Checks to see if a String contains "true".
        Parameters:
        s - A string to be checked for "true"
        Returns:
        1 if string argument is "true", and zero otherwise including null s

      • intFromArray

        public static int intFromArray(byte[] b,
                               int offset)
        Assuming an array in little endian order, build an int from 4 bytes
        Parameters:
        b - an array of bytes
        offset - the offset into b where to start getting the int
        Returns:
        An integer assuming the bytes are in little endian order.

      • shortFromArray

        public static short shortFromArray(byte[] b,
                                   int offset)
        Assuming an array in little endian order, build an short from 2 bytes
        Parameters:
        b - an array of bytes
        offset - the offset into b where to start getting the short
        Returns:
        An short assuming the bytes are in little endian order.

      • stringFromArray

        public static java.lang.String stringFromArray(byte[] b,
                                               int offset,
                                               int len)
        Assuming a array of bytes containing ASCII characters, build a string
        Parameters:
        b - the array of bytes
        offset - the index to beginning of string
        len - Then number of bytes to put in the String
        Returns:
        The string with len bytes starting from b[offset]
